lead_paragraph: Vernon Forrest withstood a late rally by Carlos Baldomir to win the World Boxing Council superwelterweight championship in a unanimous decision in front of an estimated capacity crowd of 2,200 at the Emerald Queen Casino in Tacoma, Wash., on Saturday night.The 6-foot Forrest stood 5 inches taller than Baldomir and had a 6-inch reach advantage. Forrest (39-2) used left jabs to set up body and head shots with his right. Baldomir (43-11-6) took a number of tough punches but did not take shots to the body as well as he took the shots to his face. The judges scored it 118-109, 118-109 and 116-111 for Forrest.
